channel.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
channel.description:
Well I suppose its time I got around to it. I think Ill do one or two every week because its so boring scanning in pages over and over. I have scanned in all pages except the adverts, all articles etc apart from adverts!
http://marc.cleave.me.uk/ee.htm

item.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:12, topic:326102”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=422518.msg3115147#msg3115147 date=1264896913]

my printer has a thing where u put in as many pages as u want and it scans them automatically, tho i guess it wouldnt work for a magazine

Yeah, automatic document feeding. The problem with books and magazines is that you have to be prepared to remove the spine (which means a loss of the hard copy).

In my case it would mean taking the two staples out! I aint doing that!

You can staple it back together after your done? Or do you love those vintage staples!
[/quote]

It would ruin them and they arnt mine![/quote]
Ok well that makes more sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:2, topic:326102”]You should really scan the entire thing. You need to think of Digital Preservation of information. What may not be relevant nowadays, is still important. But thanks for doing this![/quote]This.

But yea thanks, I love these things!

Read full topic

item.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

la­wl:

my printer has a thing where u put in as many pages as u want and it scans them automatically, tho i guess it wouldnt work for a magazine

Mine also has a tray scanner in which I can put all the pages on the tray and it pulls them through, this printer is about 2 years old. All you have to do is pull all the pages out then put them on the tray. Scan the fonts, then scan the backs.

HP C6180 Photosmart Printer.

Read full topic

item.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Few disadvantages, you cant find 30 year old transistors so you have to fine the equivalent, also wiper control come standard! I really need one of the things google has!

Read full topic

item.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Send them to Google and get them to put them all on Google Books. They have some awesome machine with vacuums and lasers and shit that can scan entire books in a few minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Everday electronics [Current:Issue 1]
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You should really scan the entire thing. You need to think of Digital Preservation of information. What may not be relevant nowadays, is still important. But thanks for doing this!

Read full topic
